item.title: Oil Sets Fresh 10-Month High on Saudi Cuts
item.description: Oil prices rose to a fresh 10-month high, with ANZ estimating the market will witness a 2 million barrel-a-day supply deficit this quarter thanks to the Saudi cuts and growing demand in China.

item.title: Euro to Weaken Further Vs Dollar This Year, Recover in 2024, Metzler Forecasts
item.description: The euro is set to fall against the dollar up until year end before recovering next year, Metzler forecast, expecting the euro to end the year at $1.06 before rising to $1.07 and then $1.08 in the first and second quarters of 2024, respectively.

item.title: Lonza CEO Announces Abrupt Departure
item.description: Lonza’s shares fell almost 7% on news the CEO would depart at the end of September, which RBC described as unexpected and was unlikely to provide the market with confidence heading into next month’s capital-markets day.

item.title: Chinese Shares End Higher on Improving August Economic Data
item.description: Chinese shares ended higher, as investor sentiment was boosted by better-than-expected August economic data released Friday, which raised hopes that Beijing’s stimulus measures have been effective.

item.title: Greek-German Bond Spread Slightly Narrows After Moody's Upgrades Greece
item.description: Greek government bonds marginally outperformed their eurozone peers after Moody’s Investors Service upgraded Greece by two notches to Ba1 with stable outlook on Friday.

item.title: SocGen Outlines New Strategic Plan
item.description: SocGen has targeted a return on tangible equity of 9%-10% in 2026, and forecast lower average annual revenue growth for the 2022-2026 period, as it aims to streamline its portfolio and reduce oil-and-gas exposure.

item.title: U.K. House Prices Post Modest Monthly Rise
item.description: The average house price in the U.K. rose 0.4% in the month to Sept. 9, amid sluggish activity in the market, with interest-rate rises and summer holidays leading to price reductions not seen since January 2011.

item.title: You Might Be Paying Too Much for That Index Fund
item.description: The push toward zero-cost exchange-traded funds nears the finish line.

item.title: Ukraine's Hunger for Howitzers Transforms an Arms Industry
item.description: South Korea has become the world’s fastest-growing weapons exporter as Ukraine’s allies seek to quickly replenish their supplies.

item.title: China Evergrande Shares Dip After Police Detain Some Wealth-Management Unit Staff
item.description: China Evergrande Group’s shares dipped after police in southern China detained some staff at its wealth-management unit, adding to the debt-laden developer’s woes.

item.title: Ukraine Hunts for Cash as Fighting Drains Coffers
item.description: Faced with another year of fighting, finance officials in Kyiv are using a patchwork approach to pay for a planned 50% increase in military spending.

item.title: A letter in the Vatican's archives suggests that Pope Pius XII knew about the Nazi death camps as early as 1942, adding another element to the debate over the pontiff's silence on the wartime genocide.
item.description: A letter in the Vatican’s archives suggests that Pope Pius XII knew about the Nazi death camps as early as 1942, adding another element to the debate over the pontiff’s silence on the wartime genocide.

item.title: New Orleans District Attorney Jason Williams hired a team of people who once tracked international terrorists online to take a 21st-century approach to tackling a surge in violent crime in his jurisdiction.
item.description: New Orleans District Attorney Jason Williams hired a team of people who once tracked international terrorists online to take a 21st-century approach to tackling a surge in violent crime in his jurisdiction.

item.title: Two groups of House Republicans put together a short-term funding proposal to prevent a government shutdown and break a party deadlock, though it wasn't clear if the legislation has enough votes to pass the chamber.
item.description: Two groups of House Republicans put together a short-term funding proposal to prevent a government shutdown and break a party deadlock, though it wasn’t clear if the legislation has enough votes to pass the chamber.

item.title: For Ukrainian soldiers struggling to make headway against entrenched Russian troops, the counteroffensive is taking on a new urgency as summer gives way to shorter days, drenching rain and then snow.
item.description: For Ukrainian soldiers struggling to make headway against entrenched Russian troops, the counteroffensive is taking on a new urgency as summer gives way to shorter days, drenching rain and then snow.

item.title: Recent research from academics and consultants puts the success rate of M&A closer to even compared with earlier studies that indicated a majority of deals failed to create value for the buyer.
item.description: Recent research from academics and consultants puts the success rate of M&A closer to even compared with earlier studies that indicated a majority of deals failed to create value for the buyer.

item.title: Production delays caused by the monthslong Hollywood writers and actors strikes mean the coming slate of shows on ABC, NBC, CBS, Fox and the CW will look a lot different from past years.
item.description: Production delays caused by the monthslong Hollywood writers and actors strikes mean the coming slate of shows on ABC, NBC, CBS, Fox and the CW will look a lot different from past years.

item.title: San Francisco's beleaguered office market, the hardest hit of any in the U.S. since 2020, is beginning to display flickers of life.
item.description: San Francisco’s beleaguered office market, the hardest hit of any in the U.S. since 2020, is beginning to display flickers of life.

item.title: TV host Drew Barrymore, who faced backlash for taping new episodes of her daytime show amid a monthslong writers' strike, said she would pause the show's premiere.
item.description: TV host Drew Barrymore, who faced backlash for taping new episodes of her daytime show amid a monthslong writers’ strike, said she would pause the show’s premiere.

item.title: A growing expectation that the Fed will keep interest rates higher for longer threatens to stifle the tech-stock rally, potentially dimming the outlook for indexes heavily influenced by the sector.
item.description: A growing expectation that the Fed will keep interest rates higher for longer threatens to stifle the tech-stock rally, potentially dimming the outlook for indexes heavily influenced by the sector.
